profile.name: Mikel Lindsaar
profile.bio: Founder of StoreConnect & MetaPulse & reinteractive. Built and sold 4 SaaS companies in the last decade. Author of TRUE TEAM.

analysis.career_trajectory: Started with Ruby on Rails in 2009, exploring various gems and libraries such as bundler, sqlite3-ruby, behavior, gemcutter, treetop, simple_form, chronic, right_aws, diaspora, tmail, ey-cloud-recipes, terminator, phony, sidekiq, sassc-ruby, heroku-buildpack-imagemagick, mail, and mikel.github.io. Recently worked on projects related to Amazon Web Services (AWS) and distributed social networking.

technical_obsessions.evidence: [2010-02-08] behavior: A library for storing Rails app configuration in the database (Lang: Ruby)

comment_analytics.communication_style: Asks deep architectural questions, Nitpicks code style, and Supports mentor.

match_profile.similar_user_traits: A developer who is detail-oriented, enjoys exploring new technologies, and values simplicity in their code.
conversation_starters: What are some common pitfalls when implementing database sharding in a Rails application?
How do you approach optimizing the performance of a Ruby on Rails app?
Can you share your experience with using AWS services in a Rails project?
